main event: A resident of Flushing, New York reported seeing a large, silvery object moving from west to east across the sky on August 16, 1961.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a pinhead when overhead.
The object's appearance and motion suggested it was likely man-made satellite debris.
The observer reported the sighting lasted for 10 minutes.
The observer stated the weather conditions were hazy, with scattered clouds.
The observer was a 15-year-old male student who had previously served 10 months in the honor science corps.
result: Tentatively identified as man-made satellite debris
